General Knowledge_Easy.question: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye.
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: This is a common myth. The Great Wall is too narrow to be seen from space without aid.

General Knowledge_Easy.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: Mars appears red due to iron oxide on its surface.

General Knowledge_Easy.question: Are there more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way?
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: Earth has about 3 trillion trees while the Milky Way has 100-400 billion stars.

General Knowledge_Easy.question: If the Sun were the size of a beach ball (40cm), how far away would Earth be?
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: At this scale, Earth would be about 43 meters away.

General Knowledge_Easy.question: Goldfish have a memory span of only 3 seconds.
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: Goldfish can remember things for months, not just seconds.

General Knowledge_Easy.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: The Pacific Ocean covers about 63 million square miles.

General Knowledge_Easy.question: Is the Amazon Rainforest larger than India in area?
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: The Amazon is about 5.5 million km², while India is 3.3 million km².

General Knowledge_Easy.question: Which country has the most time zones?
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: France has 12 time zones due to its overseas territories.

General Knowledge_Easy.question: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: Tall structures like the Empire State Building get struck many times per year.

General Knowledge_Easy.question: Approximately how many bones does a newborn baby have?
General Knowledge_Easy.explanation: Babies have about 270 bones that fuse into 206 as adults.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid.
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: The Great Pyramid was built around 2560 BC, Cleopatra lived around 30 BC, and the Moon landing was 1969 AD.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: What percentage of the Earth's water is freshwater?
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: Only about 3% of Earth's water is freshwater, and most of that is frozen.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: Is the weight of all ants on Earth more than the weight of all humans?
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: Ants weigh about 20% as much as humans combined, roughly 80 billion kg.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: If Earth's history were compressed to 24 hours, when did humans appear?
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: Modern humans appeared about 200,000 years ago, just 2 minutes before midnight on this scale.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: The shortest war in history lasted 38 minutes.
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: The Anglo-Zanzibar War of 1896 lasted between 38-45 minutes.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: Which element makes up most of the Sun's mass?
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: The Sun is about 73% hydrogen by mass.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: Are there more possible chess games than atoms in the observable universe?
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: There are about 10^120 possible chess games vs 10^80 atoms.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: What is the only letter that doesn't appear in any U.S. state name?
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: Q is the only letter not found in any U.S. state name.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: How many times does your heart beat in an average lifetime?
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: An average heart beats about 2.5 billion times in a 70-year lifetime.

General Knowledge_Medium.question: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
General Knowledge_Medium.explanation: Venus rotates so slowly that one day takes 243 Earth days, while its year is only 225 Earth days.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: Oxford began teaching in 1096, while the Aztec Empire was founded in 1428.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: What is the rarest blood type?
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: Rh-null blood type has been found in fewer than 50 people worldwide.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: Is the number of bacterial cells in your body more than human cells?
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: Bacterial cells outnumber human cells by roughly 1.3 to 1.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: If all the DNA in your body were uncoiled, how far would it stretch?
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: Your DNA would stretch about 200 billion km, roughly twice the distance to the Sun.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: Sharks existed before trees evolved.
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: Sharks appeared about 450 million years ago, while trees evolved about 350 million years ago.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: Which country has won the most Nobel Prizes?
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: The United States has won over 400 Nobel Prizes, more than any other country.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: Is the total length of blood vessels in your body more than the circumference of Earth?
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: Blood vessels total about 100,000 km while Earth's circumference is 40,075 km.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: Which planet has the most moons?
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: Saturn has over 140 known moons, surpassing Jupiter's count.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: How many synapses are in the human brain?
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: The human brain has approximately 100 trillion synapses.

General Knowledge_Hard.question: There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the known universe.
General Knowledge_Hard.explanation: The Shannon number estimates 10^120 possible chess games vs 10^80 atoms.

Science_Easy.question: Water is the only substance that naturally exists in all three states on Earth.
Science_Easy.explanation: Water exists as ice, liquid, and vapor naturally on Earth.

Science_Easy.question: What gas do plants primarily absorb from the air?
Science_Easy.explanation: Plants use carbon dioxide for photosynthesis.

Science_Easy.question: Is the speed of light more than 1 million km per hour?
Science_Easy.explanation: Light travels at about 1.08 billion km per hour.

Science_Easy.question: How many bones are in an adult human body?
Science_Easy.explanation: Adults have 206 bones; babies have about 270 that fuse together.

Science_Easy.question: Sound travels faster in water than in air.
Science_Easy.explanation: Sound travels about 4.3 times faster in water than in air.

Science_Easy.question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
Science_Easy.explanation: Diamond is the hardest natural material known.

Science_Easy.question: Is the human body more than 50% water?
Science_Easy.explanation: The human body is about 60% water on average.

Science_Easy.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
Science_Easy.explanation: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun.

Science_Easy.question: Electrons are larger than protons.
Science_Easy.explanation: Protons are about 1,836 times more massive than electrons.

Science_Easy.question: What is the boiling point of water at sea level in Celsius?
Science_Easy.explanation: Water boils at 100°C (212°F) at sea level.

Science_Medium.question: A teaspoon of neutron star material would weigh about 6 billion tons.
Science_Medium.explanation: Neutron stars are incredibly dense, with a teaspoon weighing billions of tons.

Science_Medium.question: What is the most abundant gas in Earth's atmosphere?
Science_Medium.explanation: Nitrogen makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere.

Science_Medium.question: Is a photon of blue light more energetic than a photon of red light?
Science_Medium.explanation: Blue light has a shorter wavelength and thus higher energy than red light.

Science_Medium.question: Approximately how many neurons are in the human brain?
Science_Medium.explanation: The human brain contains approximately 86 billion neurons.

Science_Medium.question: Glass is actually a liquid that flows very slowly.
Science_Medium.explanation: Glass is an amorphous solid, not a slow-moving liquid.

Science_Medium.question: What type of rock is formed from cooled lava?
Science_Medium.explanation: Igneous rock forms when magma or lava cools and solidifies.

Science_Medium.question: Is the temperature at the Sun's core more than 10 million degrees Celsius?
Science_Medium.explanation: The Sun's core is about 15 million degrees Celsius.

Science_Medium.question: What particle is responsible for electromagnetic force?
Science_Medium.explanation: Photons are the force carriers for electromagnetic interactions.

Science_Medium.question: How long does it take for light from the Sun to reach Earth?
Science_Medium.explanation: Light takes about 8 minutes and 20 seconds to travel from the Sun to Earth.

Science_Medium.question: Bananas are naturally radioactive.
Science_Medium.explanation: Bananas contain potassium-40, making them slightly radioactive.

Science_Hard.question: The observable universe contains more stars than grains of sand on all Earth's beaches.
Science_Hard.explanation: There are roughly 10^24 stars in the observable universe, more than all beach sand grains.

Science_Hard.question: What is the half-life of Carbon-14?
Science_Hard.explanation: Carbon-14 has a half-life of approximately 5,730 years.

Science_Hard.question: Is the mass of the Milky Way's supermassive black hole more than 1 million solar masses?
Science_Hard.explanation: Sagittarius A* has a mass of about 4 million solar masses.

Science_Hard.question: What is the approximate age of the universe in billion years?
Science_Hard.explanation: The universe is approximately 13.8 billion years old.

Science_Hard.question: There are more possible ways to arrange a deck of cards than atoms on Earth.
Science_Hard.explanation: 52! (8×10^67) arrangements vs about 10^50 atoms on Earth.

Science_Hard.question: What is the Planck length approximately equal to?
Science_Hard.explanation: The Planck length is about 1.6 × 10^-35 meters.

Science_Hard.question: Is the escape velocity from Earth's surface more than 10 km/s?
Science_Hard.explanation: Earth's escape velocity is about 11.2 km/s.

Science_Hard.question: Which fundamental force is responsible for radioactive decay?
Science_Hard.explanation: The weak nuclear force is responsible for beta decay and other radioactive processes.

Science_Hard.question: What is the speed of light in meters per second (approximately)?
Science_Hard.explanation: Light travels at approximately 3 × 10^8 m/s (299,792,458 m/s).

Science_Hard.question: The GPS system must account for both special and general relativity to work accurately.
Science_Hard.explanation: Without relativistic corrections, GPS would accumulate errors of about 10 km per day.

History_Medium.question: The Roman Empire and Chinese Han Dynasty existed at the same time.
History_Medium.explanation: Both empires overlapped significantly, from about 200 BC to 200 AD.

History_Medium.question: Which ancient wonder was located in Alexandria?
History_Medium.explanation: The Lighthouse of Alexandria was one of the tallest structures of the ancient world.

History_Medium.question: Did World War I have more military casualties than the American Civil War?
History_Medium.explanation: WWI had about 9.7 million military deaths vs 620,000 in the American Civil War.

History_Medium.question: In what year did the French Revolution begin?
History_Medium.explanation: The French Revolution began in 1789 with the storming of the Bastille.

History_Medium.question: Vikings wore horned helmets in battle.
History_Medium.explanation: This is a 19th-century myth; Viking helmets were typically rounded without horns.

History_Medium.question: Which civilization built Machu Picchu?
History_Medium.explanation: Machu Picchu was built by the Inca Empire in the 15th century.

History_Medium.question: Was the Great Fire of London 1666 more destructive (buildings destroyed) than the London Blitz?
History_Medium.explanation: The Great Fire destroyed 13,200 houses vs about 1 million from the Blitz.

History_Medium.question: Who was the first emperor of China?
History_Medium.explanation: Qin Shi Huang unified China in 221 BC and became its first emperor.

History_Medium.question: How long did the Ottoman Empire last (approximately in years)?
History_Medium.explanation: The Ottoman Empire lasted about 600 years (1299-1922).

History_Medium.question: The pyramids of Giza were built by slaves.
History_Medium.explanation: Evidence suggests they were built by paid workers, not slaves.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: The first YouTube video was uploaded in 2005.
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: 'Me at the zoo' was uploaded on April 23, 2005.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: Which film won the first-ever Academy Award for Best Picture?
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: Wings won Best Picture at the first Academy Awards in 1929.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: Has Minecraft sold more copies than Tetris?
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: Tetris has sold approximately 500 million copies vs Minecraft's 300 million.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: How many Harry Potter books are there in the main series?
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: There are 7 books in the main Harry Potter series.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: The character of Mickey Mouse first appeared in 'Steamboat Willie'.
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: Mickey first appeared in 'Plane Crazy', but 'Steamboat Willie' was his first sound film.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: Which band has sold the most records worldwide?
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: The Beatles have sold an estimated 600 million records worldwide.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: Did the original Star Wars (1977) have a bigger opening weekend than The Force Awakens (2015)?
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: The Force Awakens opened with $247M vs Star Wars' $1.5M (though adjusted for inflation Star Wars is significant).

Pop Culture_Medium.question: What was the first feature-length animated film?
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: El Apostol was released in 1917, 20 years before Snow White.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: How many seasons did the TV show Friends run for?
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: Friends ran for 10 seasons from 1994 to 2004.

Pop Culture_Medium.question: Netflix was originally a DVD rental service.
Pop Culture_Medium.explanation: Netflix started in 1997 as a DVD-by-mail rental service.
